issue.title: twitch.tv annoyance "Running ad block? Consider Turbo"
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.16.3.1867

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.twitch.tv/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

_No response_

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Dutch filter, AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Today while watching any stream a popup started to appear with text
> Running ad block? Consider Turbo.
> Twitch Turbo enables ad-free viewing while still supporting streamers.

There were [news recently](https://www.dexerto.com/twitch/twitch-joins-war-on-ad-blockers-by-hitting-users-with-discouraging-messages-3029595/) Twitch joined ad blocker war.

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

It appears every couple of minutes, very annoying and unusable.

I also have ublock chrome extension, but I disabled it on twitch - didn't help.
<details>

</details>

I also added all known twitch domains to the Adguard white list - didn't help either. Maybe there are some more exist
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5136a0df-901f-4570-80c0-6751942fbd0a)

</details>

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/187851

issue.title: myanimelist.net
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://myanimelist.net/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fmyanimelist.net%2F) ### Comment > The website background color is white, despite setting it in dark mode. > > ## Steps to reproduce: > > 1. Visit https://myanimelist.net/editprofile.php > 2. Select Dark Appearance > 3. Visit https://myanimelist.net/ > 4. Observe that the two side panels have a white background. > > ## Additional Details > > The AdGuard – Ads filter list of uBlock Origin is enabled. > The list is downloaded from: > https://filters.adtidy.org/extension/ublock/filters/2_without_easylist.txt > > The list URL is mentioned in this article, so I think that it's under your control. > I can't find the rule on GitHub, though. Is it a private list? > https://adguard.com/en/blog/easylist-filter-problem-help.html > > The offending rule is: > `myanimelist.net#$#body:not(.ownlist) { background-color: #fff !important; background-image: unset !important; background-size: unset !important; background-repeat: unset !important; }` > > This issue has already been reported before. Please find the suggested filter rule in the same comment. > https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/173921#issuecomment-1981618092 Username: `@ngoclong19` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/rh8sliq38eocg4wsg88kokw4cwsw88kn8x8tryx0dw.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/i3f2o9fujc0kwso0c80ccwo0k8084koauvi044mb1s.png?nc=1)

issue.title: twitch.tv annoyance "Running ad block? Consider Turbo"
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Mac

### AdGuard version

2.16.3.1867

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.twitch.tv/

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

AdGuard Social Media filter

### Annoyances

AdGuard Annoyances filter, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter, AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter, AdGuard Other Annoyances filter, AdGuard Widgets filter

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

AdGuard Russian filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Japanese filter, AdGuard Dutch filter, AdGuard Chinese filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Today while watching any stream a popup started to appear with text
> Running ad block? Consider Turbo.
> Twitch Turbo enables ad-free viewing while still supporting streamers.

There were [news recently](https://www.dexerto.com/twitch/twitch-joins-war-on-ad-blockers-by-hitting-users-with-discouraging-messages-3029595/) Twitch joined ad blocker war.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/57b23b67-f567-427b-b780-2401ffe37e41)

</details>

It appears every couple of minutes, very annoying and unusable.

I also have ublock chrome extension, but I disabled it on twitch - didn't help.
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d47a7695-4303-42c3-84a8-9a6f89c7d5b6)

</details>

I also added all known twitch domains to the Adguard white list - didn't help either. Maybe there are some more exist
<details>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5136a0df-901f-4570-80c0-6751942fbd0a)

</details>

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I see why this rule might not works.
I'm able to enforce this message by adding some rules and the previous rule (https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/196646#issuecomment-2600016641) was for the case when there is "Allow Twitch Ads" button, but not for the case when "Try Turbo" button is displayed (I didn't notice it before).

Please check this rule:
```adblock
twitch.tv##.video-player__overlay .player-overlay-background:has(> div[class^="Layout-"] > div[class^="Layout-"] > div[class^="Layout-"] > a:is([href*="/how-to-allow-ads-browser"], [href="https://www.twitch.tv/turbo"]))
```

If it doesn't work then please click right mouse button on the `Try Turbo` element, click `Inspect` and take a screenshot.
Please expand all elements from `video-player__overlay` to `Try Turbo` button, it should looks like on the screenshot below.

<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/55cb44b0-0734-414e-9917-13433aac6bef)

</details>

And please also check this rule:
```adblock
twitch.tv#%#//scriptlet('prevent-fetch', 'edge.ads.twitch.tv/ads')
```

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@list-kr/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/List-KR/tinyShield/issues).
